statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: S. Utah 73, Denver 63
article.story: CEDAR CITY, Utah (AP) -- Justin Allen scored a career-high 25 points and Steve Barnes added 17, leading Southern Utah to a 73-63 win over Denver on Monday night. Tate Sorensen scored 11 points for the Thunderbirds (4-2), who shot 53 percent from the field and forced 21 turnovers. Alex Cox scored 15 points for Denver (1-5), while DaShawn Walker added 14 points and 10 rebounds. Southern Utah led 42-33 with 16:38 left, but Denver rallied with an 11-0 run. Cox hit consecutive 3-pointers from the left wing, and Walker hit another from the top of the key. Cox made a layup with 12:43 to play, putting the Pioneers ahead 44-42. Denver went cold from the field during the next nine minutes. After Cox s layup, the Pioneers managed just four free throws and Walker s jumper from the right baseline until Nate Rohnert made his only field goal, a layup with 3:42 left. Meanwhile, the Thunderbirds staged a decisive 21-6 run that included 3-pointers by Allen, Barnes and Marcus Carson, and a crowd-pleasing dunk by Allen on a long alley-oop pass from Barnes. Barnes kept the spurt going with a steal and a layup, and then hit a fall-away bank shot from the right wing that gave Southern Utah a 63-50 lead with 4:11 left. The Pioneers tried to get back into the game by fouling down the stretch, but Allen went 8-for-8 from the foul line in the last three minutes.
